page.title: 06Swimming baths
page.content: { {Recreation:Swimming Baths Crosby Baths were opened in 1963 and the sea-water was used to fill the pools.The baths were three times more popular than they are today.We asked how many people came in a week;there are about 3382 swimmers and 142 spectators.The main age group are teenagers and nearly twice as many males swim than females;43 schools come to swim during the week and Galas are often held at the baths. During the school holidays the busiest day is Wednesday.It costs more to swim at the weekend than in the week. The large pool is 110 feet long and 54 feet wide,whilst the learner pool is 66 feet long and 25 feet wide.There are diving boards.Cleaning takes five hours a day.Water is constantly filtered and kept at 83 degrees F.
